main.algorithm

Class Algorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.algorithm.Algorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Entropy, Gini

    public abstract class Algorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the base class for each decision tree algorithm to extend from. This will manage the DataList and can create empty frequency tables from one attribute.
    Author:
    Dan Martin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method must be implemented in a child class.

      Checks if the currentDataPoint is a valid value in the list.

      Removes the current DataPoint from the DataList.

      Resets the DataList so that it will start returning DataPoints from the start again.

      Sets the Algorithms dataList.
      void setNumBins(int b)
      Sets the number of bins that numerical data will be split into for classification.

    • Method Detail

      • setDataList

        public void setDataList(DataList dataList)
        Sets the Algorithms dataList.
        Parameters:
        dataList - DataList containing all data.

      • getBestNode

        public abstract Node getBestNode()
        This method must be implemented in a child class.
        Returns:
        Returns a Nominal, or Ordinal decision node that is created by a child algorithm class.

      • getNextDataPoint

        public DataPoint getNextDataPoint()
        Returns:
        the next DataPoint in the dataList.

      • removeDataPoint

        public DataPoint removeDataPoint()
        Removes the current DataPoint from the DataList.
        Returns:
        the removed DataPoint.

      • resetDataList

        public void resetDataList()
        Resets the DataList so that it will start returning DataPoints from the start again.

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Checks if the currentDataPoint is a valid value in the list. If this returns false, use resetDataList() to reset the currentDataPoint to 0.
        Returns:
        true/false if the currentDataPoint is a valid value in the DataList

      • setNumBins

        public void setNumBins(int b)
        Sets the number of bins that numerical data will be split into for classification.
        Parameters:
        b - must be greater than 0.
